listing.listing_description: Play in the surf at Belongil Beach and stroll back for alfresco meals from the grill and nighttime dips in your private pool. Part of a complex of 6 new beach villas, Kaylani Cove balances prime location with homestyle comforts including a gourmet kitchen and contemporary media technology. Walk 10 minutes for dinner on Byron Bay town, or explore the edge-of-the-world landscapes of Arakwal Park.The villa’s pool terrace and deck are cloistered amid walls of natural wood paneling, forming a serene sanctuary for private enjoyments. Lounge chairs accompany the plunge pool in the sun, while the shaded deck includes a dining table and high-end barbecue.Sliding glass doors create a breezy flow into the open-concept great room, where the spacious lounge welcomes downtime by the large-screen smart TV, or festive late-nights over bottles of Australian wine. The fully equipped kitchen serves a breakfast bar and second dining table, whose smooth wood surfaces invites locally sourced delicacies from New South Wales. Central air conditioning and heating keep you comfortable at all times.Kaylani Cove includes 2 large suites with king beds and ensuite bathrooms, and 2 guestrooms that share a bathroom and lounge area. The twin beds in one of the guestrooms can be combined into a split-king, and there are 2 additional twin-size beds in the overflow room. All of the rooms have air conditioning and ceiling fans.The villa's location brings together the varied delights of Australia’s easternmost edge, from the pubs and restaurants of Byron Bay, to the sands of Belongil and Tallow Beach, to the pristine shores of Arawkwal or Cape Byron State Conservation Area—all within four to ten minutes of your door.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. listing.listing_description: Located within the Four Seasons Hualalai Resort, this corner lot luxury villa overlooks the thirteenth hole of their prized, Ke’olu Golf Course. With privacy, provided by lush palm trees, this Hawaiian home features four beautiful bedrooms, an open-concept layout, and plenty of outdoor social space, making it the ideal home base for a family vacation, golf trip with friends, or a relaxing corporate retreat.Earthy tones, rich wood, and splashes of local color decorate the spacious interior of this tropical paradise. The wide-open spaces and clear sight lines encourage a relaxing, social environment with a free-flowing vibe. Countless windows and openings frame endless ocean views in every room. The kitchen is a chef’s dream. With granite counters, an island, and a breakfast bar, there’s plenty of space for fun and function. The media room is a great place to unwind, with plush couches and a wide screen television, great for a family movie night. And, all four bedrooms come with a king or queen sized bed and en-suite bathrooms. Inside, the fully equipped kitchen comes with a coffee machine, dishwasher, ice maker, and formal dining space for eight. The living spaces are outfitted with Satellite television, Wi-Fi, air conditioning, and a washer/dryer. And, there’s a media room and office space to help keep you connected. Outside, the swimming pool, hot tub, hammocks, and sun loungers create the perfect oasis for enjoying Hawaii’s amazing climate.Two 4-Seater golf carts are included with your rental for cruising the resort grounds in style, as are boogie boards, snorkel gear, beach chairs and yoga mats and props. If you are looking for the perfect home away from home, look no further. 106 Pu‘u Kole is truly “paradise found” and is nothing less than extraordinary!You’ll also have shared access to all of the Four Seasons facilities. Within the resort, you’ll have access to several restaurants, tennis courts, their championship golf course, spa, the Hale Nalu Ocean Activity Centre, and their gorgeous, private beach. If you feel like exploring some of the other beachfront around the Big Island’s coast, there are several more within twenty miles. And, if it’s golf you’re looking for, there are three more courses, outside of the resort, within twenty kilometers as well.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: Guests at this villa will have access to the Four Seasons Hualalai Resort. A mandatory Daily Resort Guest Fee per person is required to access the resort, per day will be payable directly to the resort. The Daily Resort Guest Fee is up to $250 + tax for guests ages 14 & up, and is up to $125.00 + tax for guests ages 5-13. This daily fee includes access to the sports club, spa, golf course, beach and pool services, all resort restaurants (with the exception of members-only restaurant), ocean activity center, tennis club, kids club, and a resort-wide charge card and account. Note this fee is subject to change without notice; additional fees apply as appropriate. Please consult one of our Villa Specialists for more information.

During Peak and Peak of Peak times, guests may make reservations to use hotel amenities, dining and activities once they have been registered with the resort, but only up to 2 weeks in advance of their arrival date. During Festive Season, rental Guests have dining and activity reservation access when the resort announces the opening of their Festive reservations desk, at 7am HST on that date, approximately 3 weeks prior to the start of festive season.
Access to chaises on the pool decks will still be restricted during Peak of Peak, Peak and Festive seasons.

listing.listing_description: Feel the sub-tropical breeze wash over you while gazing upon vast countryside views of Myocum at this airy, coastal home. Spend lazy afternoons reading beneath the shade of a palm tree, and keep cool in the saltwater pool. Watch as the sun sets during an alfresco dinner. Then, hop in the car and head 12-km to downtown Byron Bay for a night of dancing, and cocktails at a beachfront bar. Hamptonesque design and decor elements borrowed from minimalism create a bright and modern space to contrast with Australia’s vibrant environment. Let the clutter-free interior set your mind at ease. Focus on the views, the fresh air, and the natural sunlight that flows through Aja. Take it to the next level with a soothing bath in the alfresco tub. Open all the terrace doors, and Aja becomes one big social setting. Gather the group for a barbecue and mingle in the main lounge. You’ll also find several smaller enclaves if you’d like to sneak away for more intimate moments. On quieter evenings, pick a movie on the streaming television and relax with family. And, if there’s any work that can’t wait, the office space has the privacy you’ll need to get it out of the way. Explore the hiking trails of Tyagarah Nature Reserve, and you’ll find scenic settings for a picnic, secluded swimming areas, and fishing spots. When you emerge from the wilderness, head to downtown Byron Bay for shopping, dining, and exciting nightlife. Main Beach is known for its delicious seafood and beachfront bars. Craving even more city life? Plan a day trip north to Gold Coast. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Light spilling through a corrugated roof mimics the look of sunshine slotting between bamboo stalks in the garden of this modern townhouse in eastern Sydney. Its sleek, black-and-white interiors are brightened both by natural light and by colorful artwork. People-watch from an outdoor café along Woollahra’s Queen Street, steps away, and along the sandy crescent of Bondi Beach, 10 minutes by car.Your holiday at this vacation rental begins with a personal welcome and a gourmet basket. Nibble on the treats in the loungers in the front garden, and entertain friends and family around the wet bar, wine fridge, gas barbecue, and alfresco lounging and dining areas in the back garden. If you’ve spent the day exploring the city, spend the evening unwinding in front of the smart streaming TV, Sonos sound system, and Wi-Fi.Contemporary design is on display throughout this luxury property. A sea-blue ottoman and sleek black TV wall anchor the living room at the front of the house. Follow the steps down to the open-concept dining room and fully equipped kitchen, where dark cabinetry meets its equal in drama in a metallic countertop.The villa has one master bedroom with a king bed and private ensuite bathroom, and a second bedroom with a queen bed and access to a hall bathroom. For larger parties, there’s also a twin daybed in the office space.During your stay, you’re only steps from Queen Street in downtown Woollahra, where buttery scents from the neighborhood patisseries fill the air by day and the outdoor Moonlight Cinema lights up the night. Drive 10 minutes to some of Australia’s most iconic sights, like the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge, or take a honeymoon from the everyday on the white sands and local-favorite surf break of Bondi Beach, also 10 minutes away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find peace and tranquility at this hillside home set amongst lush greenery on the outskirts of Avalon Village. Look out over the waterway below from multi-level balconies. Relax under the shade of a beach umbrella while the kids splash around in the pool. Then, explore Avalon and the 6 beach areas in 10 minutes’ drive. Or, take a day trip to Sydney and check out the skyline from a rooftop bar.Trendy white interiors are the perfect contrast to Australia’s rugged, lush environment. Gather the group for memorable meals at one of 3 alfresco dining sets, or find your own smaller sitting area for a romantic escape with that special someone. A pair of open concept kitchen/dining/lounge areas make it easy for multiple families to vacation together.After dinner, mix a cocktail and look out over the waterway from the lounge on the upper balcony. When the sun has set, gather around the fire pit and toast marshmallows. When the kids go to bed, stretch out in the sunbed and do some stargazing or curl up by the fireplace and pick a series to binge on Smart TV. Then, take one last look at the moonlit ocean from the master’s balcony before bed.If you’re in the mood to shop, Sydney’s Oxford Street is lined with boutique fashion houses. The top end of the street has the Wine Library, a great place to rest and enjoy the locally-crafted wine. For dinner, Bondi Road, just off the beach, has some of the city’s best restaurants. And, George Street is where you’ll find the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and plenty of bars and nightclubs. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Located along the shores Watson’s Bay, in the exclusive Vaucluse neighborhood of Sydney, this incredible four bedroom is the perfect home base for an amazing summer getaway. From Villa Watson’s Bay, you’ll have incredible views of the bustling bay, as well as private waterfront access via a small sitting area at the base of the property. Within two minute’s walk, you can visit the sandy shores of Gibson’s and Kutti beaches. And, you’ll be located within twenty kilometers of Sydney’s most popular attractions, including the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and Taronga Zoo.Utilizing its hillside location, this villa captures dynamic views from four different outdoor decks, and the majority of its interior spaces as well. The decor is beach-chic, with contemporary designer furniture, stone accents, and an exciting collection of modern art. In the living room, you’ll find cozy furniture placed around an imposing fireplace. Only the finest appliances, electronics, and fixtures are used in the kitchen, four bedrooms, and three-and-a-half bathrooms. And, the master bedroom features a king sized bed, a walk-in closet, and ensuite with dual vanity and a rain shower, and there’s a balcony with views of Sydney Harbour and Watson’s Bay.Villa Watson’s Bay comes with a dry sauna, home gym, and an exciting games room that features a ping pong table, pool table, and wet bar. On the terrace, you’ll love the view from multiple lounge areas and sun chairs. At dinner, there are formal and alfresco dining areas, both seating for eight. And, the villa comes with Apple TV, Wi-Fi, an integrated sound system, and air conditioning.After you’ve spent a day or two on Gibson’s and Kutti beach, head into town and visit one of the country’s, and World’s, most popular beach areas, six kilometers away at Bondi Beach. For dinner, drinks, and nightlife, the neighborhood in the shadows of the Opera house, The Rocks, is Sydney’s entertainment capital.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
